task.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d)
task.title: Analyze Engagement in the Summary Report
task.shortdesc: Engagement should be analyzed in the summary report by looking at the engagement column, which shows the engagement captured by the selected success metric.

context.p: Engagement is not currently available in the success metrics report.

step.cmd: Select Visit as the counting methodology.

stepresult.p: Because engagement is visit-based, this is the appropriate way to interpret them.

step.cmd: Choose any success metric that has been configured in the campaign definition to capture engagement.

stepresult.p: For example, if you've named your success metric Page Count, selecting it causes the engagement column to show the average number of pages in a visit.

step.cmd: Choose to evaluate success by Engagement.

stepresult.p: Lift and confidence are calculated for the Engagement column.

step.cmd: Click Apply to update the report.

Optional: It might be useful to click
Save Settings so the report will keep this settings for future analysis.

result.p: The engagement column shows the value of the engagement, as well as the aggregate value of engagement across all visits, the lift, and statistical confidence.
For example, when a success metric capturing page count is selected the report shows the following:

ol.li:
The percentage/number of visits who have reached the mbox associated with this success metric
If **any mbox** is selected, everyone has reached it. Note that this column does not reflect engagement.
The average number of pages per visit
The total number of pages in all visits

result.p: If a success metric capturing score is selected, the report shows the following:

ol.li: The percentage/number of visits who have reached the mbox associated with this success metric
The average value (score) of a visit
The aggregate score of all visits

result.p: The report shows the following when a success metric capturing time-on-site is selected:

ol.li:
The percentage/number of visits who have reached the mbox associated with this success metric
If **any mbox** is selected, everyone has reached it. Note that this column does not reflect engagement.
The average time on site of a visit (in seconds)
The aggregate time on site of all visits (in seconds)
